entry.title: How to promote in Jujutsu Infinite
entry.summary:
There are many ways to power up in Jujutsu Infinite, and promoting your character after a certain point becomes necessary.
A dedicated ranking system is in place, which allows you to take your abilities to the next level. However, this system is slightly different in terms of how it works. Let's take a look at how you can promote your character, along with the resources you will need.
How to rank up in Jujutsu Infinite
The process begins by completing as many quests or missions as you can. Completing them will earn you various rewards and EXP. The amount of EXP you get varies based on the nature and difficulty of quests, but completing them will help you grow your in-game character.
When you begin this process, you'll have the rank of "Non-Sorcerer." Once you reach level 60, you can talk with the Clan Head NPC to rank yourself up. There are five different ranks (or, as the game calls it, Grades), and you'll need certain resources besides being at the necessary player levels. Once you fulfill the requirements and have the necessary resources, interacting with the Clan Head NPC will allow you to rank up.
All promotion levels in Jujutsu Infinite
The following table details all the prerequisites applicable for the five rank-up levels.
Grade Requirements
Grade 4 Reach Level 60 Collect 25 Mission Essence $5,000
Grade 3 Reach Level 120 Collect 50 Mission Essence $50,000
Grade 2 Reach Level 180 Collect 100 Mission Essence $100,000
Grade 1 Reach Level 240 Collect 150 Mission Essence $250,000
Special Grade Reach Level 300 Collect 200 Mission Essence $500,000
Apart from in-game credits and EXP, you'll also need to get a lot of Mission Essence. The requirements go up as you reach higher ranks, and here is our guide on the best ways to farm Mission Essence. Doing so will always keep you ready for the next rank as soon as your player level meets the requirements.

entry.title: How do Dragon Tokens work in Blox Fruits
entry.summary:
Dragon Tokens have confused many Blox Fruits players since they randomly got added to the account of certain players, but it has their use inside the game.
Incidentally, the mysterious item wasn't available in the account of every player. Instead, it got added to the accounts of those who have been Blox Fruits for some time now and had downloaded Update 24 before the developers pulled back. As I said, this item has certain uses inside the game, so let's understand how it works.
How to get Dragon Tokens in Blox Fruits
Update 24 introduced several new things to Blox Fruits, which included an updated version of the Dragon Fruit. Unfortunately, the update was pulled back by the developers, and players who had the Dragon Fruit lost access to it. To compensate the players, they were handed something called a Dragon Token.
Again, this token is of two types. Players having a non-permanent or physical version of the Dragon Fruit were provided with a regular Dragon Token. Those who had a permanent Dragon Fruit were provided with a Permanent Dragon Token.
Incidentally, the price of Dragon Fruit has been raised from 4,000 Robux to 5,000 following the implementation of Update 24.
How to use Dragon Tokens in Blox Fruits
The use of a Dragon Token mostly depends on the type you have. If you have a permanent Dragon Token, you can use it to obtain a permanent East or West Dragon Fruit. The version will be completely randomized, but it's a great return since you're getting an upgraded version of the Dragon Fruit.
If you received a non-permanent Dragon Token, you can use it to get a non-permanent East or West Dragon Fruit. Again, the final item you get will be completely randomized. If you end up getting a duplicate Dragon Fruit in your inventory, it will be automatically changed to a Mythical Fruit.

entry.summary:
It's time to celebrate the end of 2024 and the start of a new year with a beautiful outfit in Dress to Impress. The Sparkling Resolution outfit features a dress, necklace, and sleeves but is only available until January 2, 2025.
How to get the Sparkling Resolution outfit in Dress to Impress
The Sparkling Resolution outfit is a limited-time set available in the Dress to Impress clothing shop for $6,000 in-game cash or the equivalent of 1,500 Robux. You can buy the set's individual pieces or all three items at once starting from December 30 until the event's end date, January 2, 2025.
Screenshot by Destructoid
You can view the Sparkling Resolution outfit by selecting the shoe and lipstick button on the left side of your screen and navigating to the dress button.
You have the option to buy each of the three items separately or all at once if you have enough cash. Below is the cost of every Sparkling Resolution piece:
Sparkling Dress: $4,500
Sparkling Sleeve: $1,000
Sparkling Necklace: $500
Purchasing all three pieces costs $6,000 in-game money, making it not only possible to acquire without spending real money but making it cheaper than sets like Myra the Magical Girl. However, it's only available until January 2, giving you just a few days to get your hands on this exclusive outfit.
It doesn't come with a hairstyle or makeup, though, so you may have to use a few Dress to Impress codes to complete the set.
Like other outfits in Dress to Impress, you can customize the Sparkling Resolution set to match your current theme. Depending on the theme, you may have to change it to other common colors like white, black, red, or a mix of several hues. entry.title: How to get Frost Petals in Jujutsu Infinite
entry.summary:
After much confusion over the last few days, there's finally some clarity over Frost Petals in Jujutsu Infinite. This peculiar resource has been present inside the game since its launch, but there was no way to obtain it, getting players stuck in a particular quest, but that is no longer the case.
Here is how you can get Frost Petals in Jujutsu Infinite, and what's the best way to use it.
Best Frost Petals location in Jujutsu Infinite
For most resources in Jujutsu Infinite, opening chests is the best way forward. That's not the case for Frost Petals, which spawns all over Yuki Fortress. While the spawn spots aren't restricted to one single location, they can be generally found behind the fort.
Move towards the edge of the map in this region, and you'll find plenty of Frost Petals. The middle of the map also has these flowers spawning on the ground. Once picked, the flower will take 10 minutes to respawn on your server. If you're willing to be patient and dedicate an hour or so, you can pick plenty of Frost Petals.
Incidentally, this is the only plant that spawns in the Yuki Fortress area. Other plants like Cursebloom and Spring Puffs can't be found here. Frost Petals also seem exclusive to the Yuki Fortress area, and you'll have to level up decently to access this location.
How to use Frost Petals in Jujutsu Infinite
Frost Petals work differently from other resources like Maximum Scrolls or Purified Curse Hands. You can use five of them to complete daily quests in the Yuki Fortress Area. If you're a beginner, your first priority is leveling up to Level 300 or higher. Doing so will allow you access to this area and help you to enhance your character further. entry.title: How to Limit Break in Anime Adventures
entry.summary:
Limit Break is a powerful form of enhancement that will be extremely useful in Anime Adventures if you want to boost your characters.
There are several ways to power up your characters in the game. Doing so is extremely fruitful, as the first part of the relaunch might feel boring for many. Thanks to the enhancements, you can power up your characters faster. Here's how limit breaking works in the relaunched version of Anime Adventures.
Limit breaking in Anime Adventures, explained
To Limit Break, you'll need to have 12 Mythic or higher units and also get a Divine Wish. Getting characters isn't a big challenge, and you can do it using different methods. The trickier task is to get the Divine Wish, which is mandatory to enhance your characters.
Complete the following steps once you have a Divine Wish:
Go to the Evolve area.
Talk with the Limit Break NPC.
Select the unit you want to Limit Break using the Pick Unit option.
Click on the icon on the right and decide which units you'll sacrifice.
Complete the process by selecting 12 Mythic units and one Divine Wish.
Click Limit Break to upgrade the character of your choice. The characters you sacrificed won't return.
Image by Destructoid
Best ways to farm Divine Wish in Anime Adventures
The best way to get Divine Wish in Anime Adventures is by paying attention to the daily challenge. You will be guaranteed one wish daily if you complete the daily challenge. Also, be on the lookout for limited-time events. Some of these events will drop Divine Wish among the rewards.
Once you Limit Break a unit, all characters on your board will get a 5% permanent damage boost. Once you've collected enough characters, make sure to Limit Break your best units to increase your team's potential.

entry.title: Path Of Exile 2 early access review: an expressive, characterful ARPG with plenty to chew on
entry.summary: At any given moment I am in the center of a wonderful vortex of skeletons. Bones splash and rattle and burst out of the ground in sharp, horrible spurs. My weakest skeletons, sensing their death coming, explode into fire and shards. My strongest skeletons fight so hard and with such alacrity that upon dying, they drag their spirits together and keep fighting as ghosts for a while. Foul little bone scorpions skitter around on fans of legs made from human hands. Somewhere in the middle, almost invisible among the noise, is the character I am actually playing: Path of Exile 2’s mean-spirited, callous, and gleefully enjoyable Witch. This is a review in progress. It has to be. Even in its incomplete early access period, Path of Exile 2 is a great sprawling mass of a game. Three meaty acts of a planned six act campaign are followed by a trickier return tour through them, before the absurd endgame kicks into gear and the real work begins. If I came to you having played everything on offer I would be wild-haired, bloodshot-eyed and possessing perfect, incomprehensible knowledge. Let’s compromise: I have toured the dark caverns and the antediluvian crypts. I have been killed by various accumulated nasties. I’ve had a great time. Read more

entry.title: Caves Of Qud review: an obscenely rich roguelike realm you could get lost in for months
entry.summary: "We are a people who honour democracy," said the dog, scratching himself. "Per our custom, you may drink of our fresh water." The dog was called Senator Umeshefaat, and he was very civil, even if he was shedding his black and white fur everywhere. We spoke in his home village at dawn. Later, I examined the senator's personal history more thoroughly and discovered he was "hated by bears for cooking them a rancid meal." I suppose every politician has their enemies. That Caves Of Qud creates fun anecdotes out of simple encounters shouldn't be a surprise. It has had 15 years of early access to establish itself as a small-but-mighty story generating roguelike of repute (there's a reason it sits deservedly side-by-side with Dwarf Fortress in the same publishing house). After creating many characters, and dying and dying and dying again, I understand why it grips the brain with such fierce glee. It is a machine of grand imagination and adventuresome comedy. A deceptively powerful RPG that isn't half as obtuse to newcomers as the screenshots make it out to be. Qud's low-res bark is just a complement to its bite. Read more

entry.title: Warren Spector and Thief's game director are making a multiplayer immersive sim called Thick As Thieves

Lit by gaslamps that can’t quite dispel the industrial haze, they pass for a civilian - a rough one, admittedly, but not shady enough to cause an itch in the swordarm of any passing guard. Until, that is, they take to the thieves’ highway - following the trajectory of their grappling hook upward to the rooftops, from which they can see the shape of the city, and the moon beyond. Up here, it’s a parallel world - the trees on street level answered by chimney stacks, and the distant hills echoed by the rise and fall of steep gables. “We’re super proud of these rooftops,” says Greg LoPiccolo. “It’s an amazing landscape that we put a lot of thought and effort into, and it’s a lot of fun to traverse.” Back in 1998, LoPiccolo was the game director who saw Thief: The Dark Project to completion. Today - after an 18 year detour to Harmonix to lead projects like Guitar Hero and Rock Band, among other adventures - he’s the game director of Thick as Thieves. “It really is an opportunity to do something unique and cool and new, on the shoulders of this stuff that is now well-respected,” he says. “Thief has some legs, right? entry.title: Total War: Warhammer’s Rich Aldridge on roleplaying, iteration, and lessons from nearly a decade on strategy’s most ambitious series
entry.summary: In more ways than one, today’s Total War: Warhammer 3 expansion marks a milestone for game director Rich Aldridge and his team at Creative Assembly. Omens Of Destruction’s three headline legendary lords each bring new campaigns and units for their respective factions, but it’s the fourth lord - a Khorne champion free to all players - that I imagine Aldridge will end up remembering the most fondly. When Total War: Warhammer released back in 2016, it shipped with eight legendary lords - famous characters from Games Workshop’s fantasy setting that here act as faction leaders. The number grew steadily and, in terms of announcement order at least, today’s addition of Arbaal The Undefeated marks the series’ 100th. That's a hundred campaigns, a hundred joint efforts of game design, animation, art, writing and voice work. Aldridge has never been shy about the team’s ambition for the series to eventually offer up each unit from every Fantasy Battle 6th edition army book ("The goal is to do everything, right?"). But ambition is one thing, and considering the fraught conditions at Creative Assembly and parent company Sega over the past few years, it’s not just the addition of the 100th lord that feels like something to celebrate. It’s taken time, effort, and a siesmic shift in update frequency, but Total War: Warhammer III is in the best place it's ever been. Read more
